item.title: ASP.NET Routing with IIS 7 â€“ Remember Your Modules
item.description: ASP.NET 4.0 introduces routing and it works very well. With IIS 7, there are some interesting configuration options that can help improve your site's performance. When done wrong, they can have unexpected side effects. And we're going to look at one of them today. Extensionless Urls and Wildcard Mappings Before IIS 7, the easy way to get extensionless urls when working with routing would be to have a wildcard mapping (yes, I know there are other ways with ISAPI handlers and stuff, but that's not too simple).
